name: Berlin
content: Berlin is the capital of Germany, known for its history, culture, and role as a major European political hub.

name: Paris
content: Paris is the capital of France, famous for its art, fashion, gastronomy, and landmarks like the Eiffel Tower.

name: Rome
content: Rome is the capital of Italy, renowned for its ancient history, architecture, and role as the seat of the Roman Empire.

name: Madrid
content: Madrid is the capital of Spain, a vibrant city known for its royal palace, museums, and lively cultural scene.

name: London
content: London is the capital of the United Kingdom, a global financial hub and cultural center with iconic landmarks.

name: Lisbon
content: Lisbon is the capital of Portugal, known for its hills, historic trams, and maritime heritage.

name: Athens
content: Athens is the capital of Greece, the cradle of democracy and philosophy, with landmarks like the Acropolis.

name: Vienna
content: Vienna is the capital of Austria, celebrated for its classical music heritage, imperial palaces, and quality of life.

name: Brussels
content: Brussels is the capital of Belgium and the de facto capital of the European Union, hosting major EU institutions.

name: Amsterdam
content: Amsterdam is the capital of the Netherlands, known for its canals, liberal culture, and historic architecture.

name: Oslo
content: Oslo is the capital of Norway, known for its fjords, green spaces, and role as a hub for peace diplomacy.

name: Stockholm
content: Stockholm is the capital of Sweden, spread across islands and known for its innovation and design culture.

name: Copenhagen
content: Copenhagen is the capital of Denmark, famous for its canals, cycling culture, and modern architecture.

name: Helsinki
content: Helsinki is the capital of Finland, known for its design, seaside location, and Nordic lifestyle.

name: Reykjavik
content: Reykjavik is the capital of Iceland, the world’s northernmost capital, known for geothermal energy and vibrant culture.

name: Dublin
content: Dublin is the capital of Ireland, celebrated for its literary heritage, Georgian architecture, and lively pubs.

name: Warsaw
content: Warsaw is the capital of Poland, rebuilt after World War II and now a major economic and cultural center.

name: Prague
content: Prague is the capital of the Czech Republic, famed for its medieval Old Town, Gothic churches, and historic bridges.

name: Bratislava
content: Bratislava is the capital of Slovakia, located along the Danube River and known for its medieval and baroque architecture.

name: Ljubljana
content: Ljubljana is the capital of Slovenia, a green city with a charming old town and strong focus on sustainability.

name: Budapest
content: Budapest is the capital of Hungary, divided by the Danube River and known for its thermal baths and historic architecture.

name: Bucharest
content: Bucharest is the capital of Romania, known for its wide boulevards, Belle Époque buildings, and the massive Palace of Parliament.

name: Sofia
content: Sofia is the capital of Bulgaria, located at the foot of Vitosha Mountain and rich in Roman, Ottoman, and Soviet history.

name: Tallinn
content: Tallinn is the capital of Estonia, known for its preserved medieval old town and as a hub for digital innovation.

name: Riga
content: Riga is the capital of Latvia, famous for its Art Nouveau architecture and historic Old Town on the Baltic Sea.

name: Vilnius
content: Vilnius is the capital of Lithuania, known for its baroque architecture and UNESCO-listed Old Town.

name: Valletta
content: Valletta is the capital of Malta, a fortified city built by the Knights of St. John and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Nicosia
content: Nicosia is the capital of Cyprus, the last divided capital in Europe, blending Greek and Turkish cultural influences.

name: Luxembourg City
content: Luxembourg City is the capital of Luxembourg, known for its fortified medieval old town and role as a financial hub.

name: Monaco
content: Monaco is a sovereign city-state on the French Riviera, famous for its wealth, casinos, and the annual Formula 1 Grand Prix.

name: Andorra la Vella
content: Andorra la Vella is the capital of Andorra, a small principality in the Pyrenees, known for tourism and duty-free shopping.

name: San Marino
content: San Marino is the capital of the Republic of San Marino, one of the world’s oldest republics, perched on Mount Titano.

name: Vatican City
content: Vatican City is the world’s smallest independent state, the spiritual center of the Catholic Church and home to the Pope.

name: Belgrade
content: Belgrade is the capital of Serbia, located at the confluence of the Danube and Sava rivers, with a vibrant nightlife and history.

name: Sarajevo
content: Sarajevo is the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, known for its cultural diversity and as the site of the 1984 Winter Olympics.

name: Podgorica
content: Podgorica is the capital of Montenegro, a small Balkan country with Adriatic coastline and mountainous landscapes.

name: Skopje
content: Skopje is the capital of North Macedonia, known for its Ottoman and Byzantine heritage and modern monuments.

name: Tirana
content: Tirana is the capital of Albania, a colorful city with Ottoman, Fascist, and Soviet-era architecture.

name: Zagreb
content: Zagreb is the capital of Croatia, combining Austro-Hungarian architecture with a lively café culture.

name: Vaduz
content: Vaduz is the capital of Liechtenstein, a small principality in the Alps, known for its castle and financial sector.

name: Moscow
content: Moscow is the capital of Russia, a vast metropolis known for the Kremlin, Red Square, and its role as the country’s political and cultural center.

name: Kyiv
content: Kyiv is the capital of Ukraine, one of Eastern Europe’s oldest cities, with landmarks like Saint Sophia Cathedral and Maidan Square.

name: Minsk
content: Minsk is the capital of Belarus, a city with Soviet-era architecture, broad avenues, and cultural institutions.

name: Chisinau
content: Chisinau is the capital of Moldova, known for its Soviet-style architecture, parks, and wine culture.

name: Ankara
content: Ankara is the capital of Turkey, located in Anatolia, serving as the nation’s administrative and political center.

name: Tbilisi
content: Tbilisi is the capital of Georgia, nestled in the Caucasus, known for its diverse architecture and sulfur baths.

name: Yerevan
content: Yerevan is the capital of Armenia, one of the world’s oldest continuously inhabited cities, with Mount Ararat as its backdrop.

name: Baku
content: Baku is the capital of Azerbaijan, located on the Caspian Sea, known for its medieval old city and modern Flame Towers.

name: Astana (Nur-Sultan)
content: Astana, also known as Nur-Sultan, is the capital of Kazakhstan, a planned city with futuristic architecture in the steppe.

name: Bern
content: Bern is the capital of Switzerland, a city with medieval old town charm, arcaded streets, and the seat of the Swiss government.
